{"step_by_step_thinking": "The active form of vitamin D is created in the kidneys. According to Document [20], 25 hydroxycholecalciferol becomes further hydroxylated in the kidney to its biologically most active form, 1,25-dihydroxycholecalciferol. This is also supported by Document [28], which states that calcifediol is converted by the kidneys to calcitriol, the biologically active form of vitamin D.", "answer_choice": "C. 1, 25 dihydroxy cholecalciferol"}
